title: Solubility of compounds from Lewis structures

content.question: Based on their Lewis diagrams, which of the following pairs of liquids are most soluble in each other?

choices.label: The figure presents two Lewis diagrams. In the first diagram,  a C atom is connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The C atom is also connected to another C atom by a single bond. The second C atom is connected two H atoms and an O atom by single bonds.  There are two nonbonding pairs of electrons on the O atom. The O atom also connected to an H atom by a single bond. In the second diagram, an O atom that has two nonbonding pairs of electrons is connected to two H atoms by single bonds.

The figure presents two Lewis diagrams. In the first diagram, a C atom is connected to four Cl atoms by single bonds. Each of the Cl atoms has three nonbonding pairs of electrons. In the second diagram, an O atom that has two nonbonding pairs of electrons is connected to two H atoms by single bonds.

The figure presents two Lewis diagrams. In the first diagram a C atom is connected by single bonds to 3 H atoms and an O atom. The O atom has 2 nonbonding pairs of electrons and is connected to an H atom by a single bond. In the second diagram, five C atoms are connected linearly to one another by single bonds. The two C atoms at the ends are each connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The other three C atoms in the middle of the chain are each connected to two H atoms by single bonds.

The figure presents two Lewis diagrams. In the first diagram, a C atom is connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The C atom is also connected to an O atom. There are two nonbonding pairs of electrons on the O atom. The O atom is also connected to an H atom by a single bond. In the second diagram, six C atoms are connected linearly to one another by single bonds. The two C atoms at the ends are each connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The other four C atoms in the middle of the chain are each connected to two H atoms by single bonds.

content.answer: The figure presents two Lewis diagrams. In the first diagram,  a C atom is connected to three H atoms by single bonds. The C atom is also connected to another C atom by a single bond. The second C atom is connected two H atoms and an O atom by single bonds.  There are two nonbonding pairs of electrons on the O atom. The O atom also connected to an H atom by a single bond. In the second diagram, an O atom that has two nonbonding pairs of electrons is connected to two H atoms by single bonds.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
